name: Axiom of Empty Set
informal_description: There exists a set that contains no elements at all. This set is called the empty set and is usually denoted ∅ or {}.

examples.explanation: A set with no elements inside
Since unicorns don't exist, this set has no elements
No real number squared gives -1, so this set is empty

counterexamples.explanation: A set containing the empty set as an element is not itself empty

historical_context: The concept of 'nothing' as a mathematical object was controversial. Ancient Greeks avoided it. The empty set was formalized in 19th century set theory and became crucial for modern mathematics.
pedagogical_notes: Students often struggle with the concept of 'nothing' being 'something'. Use analogies like empty containers. Key insight: ∅ has 0 elements, {∅} has 1 element (which happens to be ∅).

proof_sketches.description: There is exactly one empty set
steps: Suppose A and B are both empty sets
This means ∀x (x ∈ A ↔ x ∈ B) (both are false)

relationships.description: Empty set defined by having no members
Uniqueness of empty set follows from extensionality
Empty set is subset of every set
